review: The Apple TV is a fantastic, affordable device to add to your home theater setup. It allows you to:- Rent and purchase from Apple's vast digital library of movies and TV shows;- Play music from streaming radio stations (of which there are hundreds to choose) or your own music if you sign up for iTunes Match;- Browse your pictures from photo stream (quick tip: create a "shared" photo stream titled "apple TV" and add pictures from your phone or iPad that you want used as a screen saver, then set the Apple TV to use that stream for screen saver purposes);- Setup a home media library and have all of your movie collection at your fingertips (GREAT for kids, no more scratched or lost discs, and material can be censored with parental controls);- Use AirPlay to stream audio or video to your TV effortlessly (great for playing services like Spotify or watching video stored on an iPhone or iPad);- Use NetFlix, HBO Go, YouTube, Hulu, or any number of other supported services directly from the device with clean, easy-to-use interfaces and 1080p & surround sound support.There's no question that if you don't own any Apple devices the value of the product diminishes a bit. There are other devices that will play NetFlix, HBO Go, YouTube, etc., that will stream home library content (although most of those don't allow for parental controls if they're using DLNA as their backbone technology), etc. But if you have just one Apple mobile device - a phone or a tablet - the Apple TV is hands-down worth purchasing. It seamlessly integrates into your environment and allows you to enjoy the Apple ecosystem on your television, and AirPlay is such a convenience.

author: The Hughdns

review: iPhones and three of these Apple TVs.  We've migrated from Windows over the last few years, much to the chagrin of my Microsoft employed brother in law and are more than satisfied with the move.The home sharing feature allows us to access all of our photos and videos which are stored on our Apple Time Capsule.  We can also throw content to the big flat screen from our various hand held devices and of course, access our music library and the various on demand services that Apple TV does support including Netflix and Apple's own iTunes store.  These functions were the reason I purchased this since we already had a Roku which provided the same content and then some including Amazon Prime and is also a great device.The remote control is a work of minimalist art which allows you to navigate the user interface with just a few buttons.  This matches the design of the unit itself which is a simple hockey puck sized black plastic box whose light weight allows for it to be mounted discretely with just some adhesive backed velcro.  You can also use your iPhone as a back up remote once you install the app.Over all, this is a great unit to add to an Apple household due to its ability to let you share content, access your iTunes library, etc..  However, if this isn’t important to you a Roku might serve you better.  Google also has a new streaming device on the market that certainly warrants a look.
